learningContent.title: The conref attribute

lcInstruction.p: A conref directly references a reused element using three pieces of information:

ul.li: The path to the topic file containing the referenced element
The ID of the topic that contains the referenced element
The ID of the referenced element

lcInstruction.p: If the referenced element is in the same file as the referencing element (not a common occurrence), the path to the file can be omitted.
In DITA not every element requires an ID, but it is required for any reused element.
lcInstruction.note: If the element you want to reuse does not have an ID, your DITA editor or content management system might prompt you to create an ID for the reused element as one of the steps in creating the conref. An ID must start with a letter, number, or underscore.
lcInstruction.p: The value of the conref attribute contains the location of the referenced element. In the example below, the warehouse topic warnings.dita contains a reusable <note> element.

To reuse the <note> element in another topic, create an empty <note> element, and use the conref attribute to identify the element to be reused. In this example, the files are stored in a local filesystem; the folder named “warehouse” contains the warnings topic with the <note> element you want to reuse is stored in the warehouse folder.

The contents of the conref attribute might look a bit intimidating. Most DITA authoring tools help you fill in the conref attribute. value to correctly identify the location of the reused target element as in this easyDITA example:
The following table shows some examples of how the conref attribute value is formatted in various situations. You would replace the placeholders in these examples:

li.p: topicID is the id of the topic that contains the reused content
targetID is the id of the reused element
folder is a directory in a local file system
file.dita is the name of a DITA file
http://example.com is the name of a network computer

strow.stentry: In a topic in a local file system
In a topic at a network location
